application.name: autoseed
application.brief: Creates a control network for a list of images

description.p: This program creates a first guess control network with tie points between overlapping images. The control network is based on the available pointing information for each image (most likely SPICE).

history.change: Changed category from Geometry to Control Networks
Added the optional CNET parameter and fixed memory leaks.
Removed beta status, fixed a bug, and added test.
Replaced the cerr output with the ERRORS option.
Added the seed definition parameters to the results group of the print.prt file

parameter.name: FROMLIST
parameter.brief: List of Input cubes to create a control network for
parameter.description: Use this parameter to select the filename which contains a list of cube filename to be used to create the control network.

parameter.name: SEEDDEF
parameter.brief: PVL file containing the description of the autoseed plugin
parameter.description: Use this parameter to select the filename which contains the definition of the type of autoseeding to be preformed. This file must contain a valid Autoseed plugin definition in PVL format.

parameter.name: OVERLAPLIST
parameter.description: This file should contain overlaps of cubes in the control network. This file can be generated by running "findimageoverlaps."

parameter.name: CNET
parameter.brief: Control Network which already seeds some of the overlap
parameter.description: Use this parameter to provide a Control Network that already seeds a portion of the provided overlap. The Control Points it contains will prevent re-seeding during execution, resulting in a new Control Network that only seeds overlaps that do not contain any Control Points. You may then use cnetmerge to combine this Control Network (CNET) with the resultant Control Network (TO) to create a single Control Network for the entire overlap.

parameter.name: TO
parameter.description: This file will contain the autoseeded control network

parameter.name: ERRORS
parameter.brief: Errors generated while seeding the overlaps
parameter.description: This file will contain the errors that occurred while seeding the overlaps.

parameter.name: NETWORKID
parameter.description: The ID or name of this particular control network. This string should be unique.

parameter.name: POINTID
parameter.brief: The pattern to be used to create point ids.
parameter.description: A string with one and only one set of question marks ("?"). This string will be used to create unique IDs for each control point created by this program. The question marks will be replaced with a number beginning with zero. For example the pattern "User????" would create point IDs "User0001" through "User9999". Note: Make sure there are enough "?"s for all the control points that may be created during this run. If all question marks are exausted the program will throw an error.

parameter.name: DESCRIPTION
parameter.description: A string describing purpose of this control network.
